A toothbrush with a built-in Bluetooth speaker: This toothbrush would have a small speaker embedded in the handle, allowing users to listen to their favorite music or podcasts while brushing their teeth. The speaker could be powered by a small battery located in the handle, and the user could control the volume and playback through a button on the handle.

A toothbrush with a built-in tongue scraper: This toothbrush would have a small tongue scraper attached to the back of the handle, allowing users to scrape their tongue clean with each brush stroke. The scraper could be made of a soft, flexible material to avoid scratching the tongue, and the user could flip it out of the way when not in use.

A toothbrush with a built-in toothpaste dispenser: This toothbrush would have a small toothpaste dispenser located in the handle, allowing users to apply the perfect amount of toothpaste with each brush stroke. The dispenser could be controlled by a button or lever on the handle, and the toothpaste could be stored in a small reservoir in the handle.

A toothbrush with a built-in UV sanitizer: This toothbrush would have a small UV light located in the handle, which would sanitize the toothbrush after each use. The UV light could be powered by a small battery located in the handle, and the user could simply place the toothbrush in the handle for a few seconds to sanitize it.

A toothbrush with a built-in timer: This toothbrush would have a small timer located in the handle, which would count down the time of each brushing session. The timer could be set to the user's preferred brushing time, and the toothbrush could vibrate or beep when the time is up to remind the user to spit and rinse. The timer could be powered by a small battery located in the handle, and the user could reset it with a button or lever on the handle.
